title: A Critical Assessment of Modern Generative Models' Ability to Replicate Artistic Styles
author: Andrea Asperti (University of Bologna), Franky George (University of Hull), Tiberio Marras (University of Bologna), Razvan Ciprian Stricescu (University of Bologna), Fabio Zanotti (University of Bologna), ...
relevance_why: The methodologies and evaluations regarding generative models could provide insights into creating more nuanced audio representations or understanding the artistic capabilities in sound generation, which may be applicable to Haohe Liu's text-to-audio generation work.
background: Evaluating how contemporary generative models replicate artistic styles and assessing their performance and aesthetic fidelity.
contribution: This paper introduces the AI-pastiche dataset to assess generative models in replicating historical artistic styles, achieving insights into their strengths and weaknesses.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Previous research mainly focused on single models or specific styles, lacking comprehensive dataset evaluations across various artistic styles.
technical_comparison.novelty: This work evaluates multiple state-of-the-art models on a large scale, enabling a more robust analysis of their style replication capabilities.

key_innovation: The creation of a large, annotated dataset specifically designed for evaluating generative model outputs in artistic style replication.
real_world_impact: The findings could influence future developments in creative AI tools, leading to enhanced digital artistry capabilities and human-AI collaboration in various artistic domains.
limitations: The study primarily focused on visual art, which may not fully translate to other generative domains such as audio or music.

new_terms.AI-pastiche dataset: **AI-pastiche** is a curated dataset of AI-generated artworks designed to assess how well generative models can replicate different artistic styles.

open_sourcing: The AI-pastiche dataset will be made publicly available on Kaggle.
